channel.title: Osmosis
channel.description: A science focused podcast bringing together Jamie McMillan (aspiring scientist) and Calum Morris (really good teacher) to breakdown a scientific paper into deliciously digestible morsels.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A science focused podcast hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris
channel.itunes:author: Osmosis
channel.itunes:summary: A science focused podcast bringing together Jamie McMillan (aspiring scientist) and Calum Morris (really good teacher) to breakdown a scientific paper into deliciously digestible morsels.

item.title: Mini moon bonus episode (with special guest!)
item.description: In this impromptu bonus episode we discuss and explore 2024 PT5, the new ‚Äòsecond moon‚Äô which will accompany us through the cosmos for the‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In this impromptu bonus episode we discuss and explore 2024 PT5, the new ‚Äòsecond moon‚Äô which will accompany us through the cosmos for the next two months. Join us as we talk with our special guest in this off the cuff episode of OSMOSISCAST.

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion. You can find the current location of 2024 PT5 in the sky using The Sky Live. Asteroid deflection is discussed and NASA‚Äôs DART mission provided demonstration of this in 2022.

Osmosis is hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris, we were joined on this episode by Lauren Bailey. Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, get in touch.

item.title: Talking turtles, conservation, and legislation with Lauren Bailey
item.description: In this very special episode we talk with environmental scientist Lauren Bailey about her experiences and work in the field of conservation‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In this very special episode we talk with environmental scientist Lauren Bailey about her experiences and work in the field of conservation. Lauren has been a big supporter of OSMOSISCAST since its inception so it was a real pleasure to have her on for a chat. We hope you enjoy!

Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris continue Osmosis with a guest appearance from environmental scientist Lauren Bailey.

Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, get in touch.

item.title: I've got McNoidea what is going on in this episode
item.description: In today‚Äôs episode we explore a paper from the mid 90s all about buzzwords and haggis‚Ä¶this piece of academic satire had us both laughing and‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In today‚Äôs episode we explore a paper from the mid 90s all about buzzwords and haggis‚Ä¶this piece of academic satire had us both laughing and marvelling at the creativity of its approach to modelling the elusive highland haggis. Expect lots of laughs, bewilderment, and maybe a little bit of learning along the way!

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion.

Osmosis is hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris. Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, get in touch.

item.title: Cracking the Standard Model - The Higgs Boson & The LHC
item.description: In this episode, we tackle one of the most groundbreaking discoveries in modern physics ‚Äì the Higgs boson. Join us as we attempt to break‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In this episode, we tackle one of the most groundbreaking discoveries in modern physics ‚Äì the Higgs boson. Join us as we attempt to break down the complex paper that confirmed its existence at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC), and explore why this elusive particle is so important. This one was for sure a challenge, but we‚Äôll try to make sense of the science behind it, explain the significance of the discovery, and discuss what it means for our understanding of the universe. Get ready for a deep dive into particle physics!

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion. Visualisation of the ATLAS detector.

Osmosis is hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris. Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, get in touch.

item.title: AI is Scary and Beautiful - Exploring Sora
item.description: In this week‚Äôs episode, we dive into the fascinating world of OpenAI‚Äôs Sora video generation software. We‚Äôll explore how this cutting-edge‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In this week‚Äôs episode, we dive into the fascinating world of OpenAI‚Äôs Sora video generation software. We‚Äôll explore how this cutting-edge AI blurs the lines between technology and artistry, creating stunning visuals with just a prompt.

Join us as we discuss the implications of AI-driven creativity, the ethical considerations of such powerful tools, and what this means for the future of content creation. Whether you‚Äôre excited or apprehensive about AI‚Äôs role in art, this episode aims to challenge your perspective and spark a deeper conversation about the intersection between innovation and imagination.

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion.

Osmosis is hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris. Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, get in touch.

item.title: LK-99, Super Conductivity, and the future!
item.description: This week, we explore the exciting world of superconductivity and are late to the party discussing LK-99. We take a deep dive into the paper‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
This week, we explore the exciting world of superconductivity and are late to the party discussing LK-99. We take a deep dive into the paper that made the mainstream media, and into the idea of the scientific method and why it works - even when the hype gets ahead of the evidence. We‚Äôll unpack the science behind LK-99, discuss the potential real-world impacts of room-temperature superconductors, and examine how breakthroughs like these can reshape our future. Join us as we separate the facts from the fiction and explore what this discovery could mean for technology, energy and beyond.

The paper discussed can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion. The rebuttal paper from the Max Planck Institute may also be of interest.

Osmosis is hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris. Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, get in touch.

item.title: Behind the Magic - Exploring Disney's Hyperion Renderer
item.description: In this episode, we take a deep dive into the world of animation by exploring Disney‚Äôs ground breaking renderer, Hyperion. Discover the‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In this episode, we take a deep dive into the world of animation by exploring Disney‚Äôs ground breaking renderer, Hyperion. Discover the innovative technology and creative processes behind some of your most loved animated films. We‚Äôll discuss how Hyperion revolutionises the way Disney brings characters and stories to life, creating stunning worlds and seamless visuals.

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion.

Osmosis is hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris. Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, get in touch.

item.title: Forecasting Middle Earth's Climate
item.description: In this episode we embark on a unique journey to the fictional world of Middle-Earth and the very non-fictional world of climate models‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In this episode we embark on a unique journey to the fictional world of Middle-Earth and the very non-fictional world of climate models. Discover how scientific techniques used to predict real-world weather patterns can be applied to the diverse regions of Middle Earth. Or listen to two 30 year old men talk about nerdy things!

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion.

Osmosis is hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris. Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, get in touch.

item.title: We're back and talking about thermal rulers
item.description: We‚Äôre back, welcome to season 2! In this episode, we dive into some fantastic and cutting-edge techniques used in the security of‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
We‚Äôre back, welcome to season 2! In this episode, we dive into some fantastic and cutting-edge techniques used in the security of intermediate-level waste containers. Today‚Äôs paper is a bit of a Jamie-special. Join us as we explore the science behind these innovative methods and their crucial role in handling radioactive materials.

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion. We also mentioned another of Jamie‚Äôs papers on a similar topic.

Osmosis is hosted by Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris. Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, drop us a line.

item.title: Wrapping up season one of the Osmosis podcast
item.description: Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris wrap up the first season of Osmosis with an outlook on what is still to come. We reflect on the first season‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris wrap up the first season of Osmosis with an outlook on what is still to come. We reflect on the first season and highlight future plans:

  • Reflection on the pilot season
  • Seasonal releases
  • Themes for episode content
  • Future plans for the cast

item.title: Shedding Light on Dark Energy - Exploring DESI's Latest Discoveries!
item.description: In Episode 005 of OSMOSISCAST, Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris delve into the latest discoveries from DESI, shedding light on dark energy‚Äôs‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In Episode 005 of OSMOSISCAST, Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris delve into the latest discoveries from DESI, shedding light on dark energy‚Äôs mysteries. Join us as we explore cosmic spectra, galactic structures, and the universe‚Äôs evolution, uncovering insights that redefine our understanding of the cosmos. Get ready for a journey through the stars that‚Äôs as enlightening as it is fascinating! üååüéôÔ∏è

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion. More details on the DESI project can be found here alongside some awesome videos of the robots! ü§ñ

item.title: Clearing the Picture - Exploring AdaIR for Noise Removal in Diverse Applications
item.description: Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris continue Osmosis, we unveil the cutting-edge technology of AdaIR and its transformative impact on noise‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris continue Osmosis, we unveil the cutting-edge technology of AdaIR and its transformative impact on noise removal in images. üì∏üîç Join us as we delve into the intricacies of this revolutionary tool, exploring its applications in video production, content creation, medical imaging, remote sensing, surveillance, and beyond. From enhancing visual clarity to improving diagnostic accuracy, AdaIR is reshaping the way we perceive and interact with images in diverse fields. Get ready to witness the power of precision and clarity as we journey through the realms of image processing with AdaIR! üåêüéôÔ∏è

The paper can be found here if you would like to follow along with the discussion alongside the project source code.

Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, drop us a line.

item.title: Exploring Plutonium, Fission, and the Chilling Tale of the Demon Core! ‚ò¢Ô∏èüìú
item.description: In episode 003 of OSMOSISCAST, Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris embark on a journey through the annals of atomic history as we delve into the‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In episode 003 of OSMOSISCAST, Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris embark on a journey through the annals of atomic history as we delve into the mysteries of plutonium, fission, and the haunting legend of the Demon Core. ‚ò¢Ô∏èüìú Join us as we explore the scientific breakthroughs and ethical dilemmas of the Atomic Age. From the transformative discoveries of nuclear science to the cautionary tales of criticality accidents, we shed light on the complex legacy that continues to shape our understanding of the atom.

These papers can be found here and here if you would like to follow along with the discussion.

Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube. If you would like to request a paper to be discussed on the show, drop us a line.

item.title: Japan's SLIM Touchdown - Lunar Mysteries Revealed!
item.description: In Episode 001 of OSMOSISCAST, we embark on an interstellar journey as we dive into the recent news surrounding Japan‚Äôs SLIM (Smart Lander‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
In Episode 001 of OSMOSISCAST, we embark on an interstellar journey as we dive into the recent news surrounding Japan‚Äôs SLIM (Smart Lander for Investigating Moon) mission. üåïüöÄ Join us for an in-depth exploration of the groundbreaking landing on the moon, unraveling the scientific wonders and mysteries behind this remarkable achievement. From the technology behind SLIM to the implications for future lunar exploration, we dissect the headlines and bring you the fascinating details that go beyond the surface. Tune in for a cosmic adventure that will leave you starry-eyed and thirsting for more lunar revelations! üååüéôÔ∏è

Find us where you find your podcasts or on YouTube.

item.title: Pizza Alchemy - Unraveling Mind-Blowing Secrets! üçï‚ú®
item.description: Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris kick it off Osmosis with The physics of baking good pizza! Welcome to Osmosis, the podcast where two best‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: Osmosis
item.content:encoded:
Jamie McMillan and Calum Morris kick it off Osmosis with The physics of baking good pizza!

Welcome to Osmosis, the podcast where two best friends bring science to life! üéôÔ∏è In each episode, we explore a different scientific paper, unraveling its complexities and making it accessible to everyone.

In our debut episode, get ready to savor the scientific flavors as we dive into the art and chemistry of crafting the perfect pizza. üçï From the physics of dough rising to the molecular magic behind the ideal tomato sauce, we break down the science that turns a simple dish into a culinary masterpiece.

Join us on this intellectual journey as we osmose knowledge, one paper at a time! üß™üìö

This can be found on the arXiv if you would like to follow along with the discussion, or perhaps you are just very interested in cooking the perfect pizza.
item.itunes:title: Pizza Alchemy - Unraveling Mind-Blowing Secrets! üçï‚ú®
